title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Monday, 22 February 2016 - BBC News
summary: nearly 50 children safeguarded in new hertfordshire police operation to stop the sharing of indecent images .
luton councillors set to raise council tax at a meeting tonight .
eric morecambe 's jensen interceptor for sale at £ 150,000 .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on tuesday .

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: that 's it for beds , herts & bucks live for today .
if you 'd like to see what we 've been up to , scroll back down the page .
we 'll be back tomorrow morning at 08:00 with the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the three counties .

documents.title: weather : dry overnight , temperatures dropping
text: mainly dry tonight with a mixture of clear spells and occasional cloud , which may bring a few isolated showers .
a cold night with the chance of frost as temperatures dip to 0c ( 32f ) in the countryside .
a chilly day on tuesday with a mixture of sunny spells and patchy cloud , which will bring a few scattered wintry showers .
temperatures reaching up to 7c ( 45f ) .
author: Dan Holley
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: stevenage singer in the running for eurovision
text: a hertfordshire singer is in the running to become this year 's eurovision entry for the uk , after her band made it through to the final six up for selection .

cara beard from stevenage is one half of country pop duo darline , and their track until tomorrow is in the running to become the uk 's entry for the competition , which is taking place in stockholm in may .
you can listen to the song here , and find out who else made the shortlist here .
author: Dani Bailey
BBC Local Live

documents.title: south west beds mp , andrew selous , 'undecided ' over eu
text: the conservative mp for south west beds , andrew selous , has told us he is still undecided about the way he will vote in the forthcoming eu referendum .
mr selous said he was `` waiting for the official cost benefit analyses of both options '' before making his decision .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: hmp woodhill inmate left fellow prisoner with 'severe brain injury '
text: hmp woodhill inmate gary vinter ( punched and kicked a fellow prisoner , leaving him with a `` severe brain injury '' , luton crown court heard .
vinter , who is serving a life sentence for two murders , is alleged to have said `` i 've done what i need to do , now get me out of here , '' after the attack in november 2014 .
he denies attempted murder and gbh with intent .
the man he was accused of attacking , lee newell , was serving a `` natural life tariff '' having been convicted of two murders in 1998 and 2013 .

documents.title: inmate denies attempting to murder fellow prisoner
text: a prisoner serving a life sentence after committing two murders tried to kill a fellow inmate in a prison exercise yard in order to be transferred to another jail , a court has heard .
gary vinter , an inmate at hmp woodhill prison , is accused of trying to murder lee newell in november 2014 and is on trial at luton crown court .
earlier , the jury was shown cctv footage of the alleged attack .
vinter denies the charge , and one of causing grievous bodily harm with intent .

documents.title: headlines : senior tory wo n't be drawn on eu vote princess royal opens new advice bureau
text: here are some of the stories we 've been looking at :

documents.title: football trio leave stevenage
text: offrande zanzala , deimantas petravicius and keith keane have all left league two side stevenage following loan spells at the club .

young forward zanzala and midfielder petravicius return to derby and nottingham forest respectively after two appearances each , while 29-year-old keane goes back to cambridge united after five playing matches for boro .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC Sport

documents.title: isaac stone 's mother talks of her 'life sentence '
text: the mother of a bedford teenager who was murdered in the town in january 2014 has penned her third blog post for bedfordshire police .
yvette lendore is speaking out about the murder of her 19-year-old son isaac stone in support of the force 's campaign against serious youth violence and knife crime .
in her latest post , she talks about the anger the youth community felt following isaac 's death and the heartache she experienced during the court process .
four men were jailed for life for the murder in september 2014 .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: paramedics treat person for shock after iver crash
text: fire crews and paramedics were called to a two-car crash in iver earlier this afternoon where a car was on its side .
bucks & mk fire said two crews were sent to the collision in bathurst walk at about 15:35 .
paramedics treated one person for shock , but no-one was seriously injured .
author: Jodie Smith
BBC News

documents.title: morecambe often ended up 'screwed up in the back ' of auction car
text: a jensen interceptor bought by comedian eric morecambe for £ 4,500 in the 1960s has been put up for sale for £ 150,000 .
the late comedian 's chauffeur mike fountain said the vehicle , marketed as a two-seater and now on sale for £ 150,000 , was morecambe 's favourite .
as there was little room for a third person , mike fountain said morecombe often ended up `` screwed up in the back '' .

documents.title: buckingham mp bercow encourages constituents to have their say on eu
text: we 've heard from another of our mps in the three counties with their thoughts on june 's eu referendum .
speaker and conservative mp for buckingham , john bercow , said he would not give any indication of which way he would vote , but said he encouraged all of his constituents to have their say .
`` i intend to exercise my right to vote in the same way as everybody else on the electoral register will be able to do , '' he said .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: princess royal arrives for citizens advice bureau opening
text: princess anne has arrived in luton to officially open the town 's new citizens advice bureau .
princess royal arriving to officially open the new citizen advice luton building .
more on @ twitterid at 6:30 .

documents.title: more mps declare eu position or do they ?
text: we 've been told by anne main 's office that the conservative mp for st albans will be voting for britain to leave the eu .
meanwhile , sir oliver heald qc ( the conservative mp for north east hertfordshire , has told us he will vote to remain in the eu .
as he is a founder member of conservatives for eu reform , which backs the prime minister , this is unsurprising .
interestingly , hertsmere mp oliver dowden and broxbourne mp charles walker , both conservatives , have told us they are still making their minds up .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: airport link road resurfacing to begin
text: work gets under way tonight to resurface the link road to london luton airport .
frank lester way will be closed from 19:00 to 04:00 from monday to thursday , and diversions will be in place on surrounding roads .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: man 'seriously injured ' in clophill crash
text: police are appealing for witnesses following a serious road traffic collision on the a6 near clophill early on sunday morning which has left one person in hospital .
a white audi a3 failed to stop when signalled to pull over by police officers at about 04:00 and a pursuit ensued until it was called off due to the `` wider risk to the public '' , police say .
shortly afterwards the car collided with a tree .
one person was taken to hospital with serious injuries and remains in a critical condition .
two further people were treated for minor injuries .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: this afternoon 's weather : cloudy with possible rain
text: this afternoon will start cloudy with the odd spot of rain possible , but this will be followed by the occasional bright or sunny spell .
thanks to bbc weather watcher alfies mate for this taken in hertford earlier today where the temperature was recorded at 8c ( 46f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: eric morecambe 's jensen interceptor up for sale
text: a car belonging to the late comedian eric morecambe is set to be sold for about £ 150,000 after going on show at this weekend 's london classic car show .

the jensen interceptor - which used to be kept in the comedian 's garage in harpenden - has been restored by warwickshire-based silverstone auctions which bought the sports car , built in 1968 , in 2014 .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: lunchtime headlines : man 'seriously injured ' after clophill crash local mps declare eu positions
text: here are the top stories this lunchtime :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: eu referendum : hertford and stortford mp 'will vote to remain in '
text: mark prisk , the conservative mp for hertford and stortford has told us he will `` be voting to remain in the eu '' in june 's referendum .
`` i will be writing to my constituents about my views over the next few days , '' he said .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: mps speak out over their eu referendum position
text: more comments now from local mps about their position on the eu referendum .
the labour mp for luton south , gavin shuker has tweeted that david cameron 's `` deal is sound '' and that `` we 're # strongerin '' .
meanwhile , the conservative mp for mid-bedfordshire , nadine dorries , has said she 's `` backing # brexit ''
not sure where the rest of my colleagues in bedfordshire stand but i 'm backing # brexit @ twitterid # out
oh i 've always liked you @ twitterid @ twitterid # brexit congrats on standing out and doing what 's in your heart
@ twitterid @ twitterid well done nadine !
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid good country before party thanks
@ twitterid @ twitterid they gave us absolutely nothing not that it would of made a difference but shows what they think of the british
@ twitterid @ twitterid i would rather stay if you do n't mind
@ twitterid @ twitterid me too ! !
@ twitterid @ twitterid michael gove 's statement sums up how i feel !
@ twitterid @ twitterid does cameron think because he says britian has a special deal everyone will fall for it !
the man 's a disaster .
@ twitterid @ twitterid but as an ex nurse do you support jeremy hunt or our nhs and # juniordoctors # nhs
i do n't love cameron , nor brussels , but britain .
this deal is sound and in our country 's interests .

the greeks are right to have four words
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: child abuse charity praises hertfordshire police for safeguarding children role
text: the national association for people abused in childhood ( napac ) has praised hertfordshire police for its role in safeguarding children involved in online abuse .

the force says 48 children have been protected and 54 arrests have been made since it was involved in operation hera , an initiative being piloted in nine forces , which aims to stop the sharing of indecent images of children .

peter saunders , from napac , said : `` when i hear that 40-50 children have been rescued from an abusive situation , saved potentially from a life of misery i think the police have done a tremendous job here . ''
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: eu referendum : east region at the forefront of the in/out debate
text: with it 's geographical proximity to europe , our trading links with the eu and many of our local mps in the leave campaign - the east of england will be at the forefront of this debate .
those who want to leave will keep telling us that in the east of england we send £ 1.9bn a year to brussels in taxes - but have had just £ 1.5bn from the eu in grants over the last seven years .
the stay campaign will argue the benefits of eu membership are worth far more than just what we get in grants .
they will talk about the £ 14bn of trade we do with the eu a year and the open borders policy which allows people to freely travel and work across the continent .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: bedfordshire man charged over 'fail to stop ' pursuit
text: a bedfordshire man has been charged after a vehicle failed to stop for police in southend during the early hours of sunday morning .
the 28-year-old from sundon was arrested after a short pursuit when a peugeot 206 failed to stop for police following a disturbance outside dick de vignes in the town 's warrior square at 03:00 .

he 's been charged with dangerous driving , failing to provide a specimen for analysis , failing to stop for police , resisting arrest and causing harassment alarm or distress to southend hospital staff .
he 's been released on police bail .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: the uk 's eu referendum : four buckinghamshire mps declare position
text: of buckinghamshire 's seven conservative mps , four have announced whether or not they are supporting a vote to keep britain in the european union .
cheryl gillan ( chesham and amersham ) , mark lancaster ( milton keynes north east ) and speaker , john bercow , ( buckingham ) have not yet announced their decision .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stevenage mp calls brussels negotiations a 'ridiculous pantomime '
text: stevenage mp , stephen mcpartland , responded to the eu referendum announcement by calling prime minister david cameron 's negotiations in brussels last week as a ridiculous pantomime '' .

announcing on his website that he will vote to leave '' the eu , the conservative mp said mr cameron 's deal did nothing to tackle nhs tourism '' and sending welfare payments to families in other countries does not make sense '' .
he said : `` i used my vote in parliament to help deliver [ the ] referendum and i am proud it is now up to the british people to decide how they will vote . ''
eu choreographed pantomime is over , now project fear will be launched to frighten british people into submission
@ twitterid @ twitterid cameron 's confidence trick is in full swing , brexit !
@ twitterid amazing speech i praise anyone who speaks up against their parties proposals do n't let the chief whip change your mind .
@ twitterid well done .
you are my local mp and i 'm delighted that you have publicly endorsed leaving the eu
@ twitterid @ twitterid advocates must present the facts of life out of eu , we must also combat the negative fear campaign lies
@ twitterid good man country first
@ twitterid @ twitterid nope not scared
@ twitterid @ twitterid # eu a sinking ship .
# projectfear
@ twitterid @ twitterid the truth is that uk jobs and exports will be damaged by # brexit so why refer to telling the truth # projectfear
@ twitterid @ twitterid no , dave is going for the `` vision thing . ''
`` safer , stronger and better off in the eu . ''
get with it !

@ twitterid @ twitterid scaremongering in relation to northern ireland particularly unedifying : @ twitterid
@ twitterid common sense speaking , with facts well done @ twitterid
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the uk 's eu referendum : which side of the fence will you find bedfordshire mps ?
text: five of bedfordshire 's six mps have declared their position in the forthcoming referendum over whether britain should stay or leave the european union .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: princess royal to visit luton today
text: a new centre for the citizen 's advice bureau in luton will be officially opened by the princess royal today .
princess anne will visit community house at new bedford road in the town , where she 'll meet staff and volunteers and unveil a plaque .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: boy dies after collision which killed his grandfather
text: a nine-year-old boy from sandy has become the second pedestrian to die following a collision in gamblingay in cambridgeshire , police have confirmed .
archie stevens , of western way , sandy , bedfordshire , died in hospital on saturday afternoon .
the collision , which involved two cars , also resulted in the death of his grandfather , martin harker , 68 , of green acres , sandy .
police were called to the collision in drove road just after 10:00 on thursday .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the uk 's eu referendum : all you need to know
text: on saturday , prime minister david cameron announced a referendum on whether britain should remain in the european union .

whether you 've already made your decision or are undecided , there 's four months before the vote on the 23 june to discuss all the finer details - so here 's bbc news online 's handy guide to all you need to know about it .
from what exactly a referendum is , to what changes david cameron has agreed and why people want to stay or go .
author: BBC News UK

documents.title: the uk 's eu referendum : where do hertfordshire 's mps stand ?
text: this weekend saw prime minister david cameron announce a referendum on whether britain should remain in the european union -it will be held on 23 june .
of hertfordshire 's 11 mps , all conservative , five have already declared their official position :

oliver dowden ( hertsmere ) , charles walker ( broxbourne ) , grant shapps ( welwyn hatfield ) , sir oliver heald ( herts north east ) , mark prisk ( hertford and stortford ) and ann main ( st albans ) have not .
yet declared their decision .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest headlines : herts police praised for safeguarding children role luton councillors due to set budget later
text: here are the top stories we 're looking at this morning :

documents.title: football : watford fc to play arsenal or hull in fa cup quarter-final
text: watford will play the winner of arsenal and hull 's replay in their fa cup quarter-final tie , due to take place across the weekend of 11-14 march .
the hornets secured a 1-0 victory over championship side leeds on saturday .
head coach quique flores said : `` we are lucky because we are working very well it is necessary to enjoy and share the experience , the journey , because it 's an amazing year for us . ''

documents.title: children protected by herts police in new operation
text: almost 50 children have been safeguarded by herts police in a new operation to stop the sharing of indecent images of children on the internet .
a specialist team of six police officers are using technology to track down those sharing the images - so far they 've made 54 arrests with 48 children safeguarded .
operation hera is being piloted in nine forces , of which hertfordshire is the second best performing .
the force hopes funding will remain in place so they can carry out more investigations .
author: Matthew Lockwood
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: luton councillors set to raise council tax
text: councillors in luton are due to set a budget tonight , which will include savings of £ 12.7m , raising council tax by 3.95 % .
among the proposals are a review of children 's centres and cuts to the youth service and luton culture .
savings are also identified in adult services and sheltered accommodation.the council would merge pest control and the dog warden service and stop the community toilet scheme .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: today 's weather : cloud and rain at first
text: it will be a cloudy start with rain , becoming drier and brighter by early afternoon .
maximum temperature : 8c ( 46f ) .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: travel update : accident on a1 ( m ) in hertfordshire
text: the a1 ( m ) is partially blocked southbound at j9 for the a6141 at letchworth due to an accident .
there are also delays and cancellations to london midland services at watford north station due to a vehicle hitting a bridge .
get the latest updates from bbc travel .
new due to a road vehicle colliding with a bridge at watford train services running through this station may be cancelled or delayed

documents.title: house fire in beaconsfield last night
text: fire crews in buckinghamshire were called to a fire in a house in beaconsfield last night .
a man was given oxygen after suffering from the effects of breathing in smoke following the fire in a bedroom in lakes lane , just before 19:00 .
volunteers from the british red cross fire and emergency support service , whose vehicle is based at marlow fire station , also attended the scene .
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: latest headlines : herts police safeguards nearly 50 children house fire in beaconsfield
text: here are the top stories we 're looking at this morning :
author: Tony Fisher
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: welcome to local live for beds , herts and bucks
text: good morning and welcome to monday 's live page for the three counties , where we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel until 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch , please feel free to tweet us or email us here .
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live
